intro: Triplaris estriata, commonly known as the streaked triplaris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves with distinct longitudinal stripes. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Triplaris estriata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
